result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Kamil J Karwat was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kamil J Karwat is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kamil J Karwat was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Kamil J Karwat was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Kamil J Karwat was found guilty of Intimidate Victim/Dissuade Reporting [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.44(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Counts 1 & 2 dismissed as part of plea agreement. Def successfully completed probation.

DPA REVISED-3RD MODIFICATION.  Fines/costs in 15TR11381-15TR11383 added to existing plan.Cases 14CF131,15TR11381,09CT4096,11TR14552,15TR11381..15TR11383.  Payments of $30/mo to continue.  DPA retained in 14CF131.
email sent x2 to Atty Ruth regarding defns unsigned bail bond form;defn has not come into sign bail bond form as of today's date;original to file
Crt orders the previously imposed requirement of a DNA sample & surcharge be striked.  Amended Judgment of Conviction prepared.
Atty Robert Ruth request for reconsideration to strike the DNA surcharge and sample;given to Judge for review
on Bond Conditions

The Court sets the following bond conditions in counts one and two:
$4,000 signature bond per count
-No contact, direct or indirect, with Anne U. without written consent from Utz and from the defendant's probation officer.
-No contact direct or indirect, with Daria U. and David U.
-The defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon.

AMENDED SIGNATURE BOND - CONDITIONS MODIFIED FOR PERMISSION TO TRAVEL
Court grants the defendant permission to travel to the Chicago/Northwestern Indiana area on the following dates:  August 22-24, 2014; August 29-31, 2014;September 1, 2014; September 5-7, 2014; September 12-14, 2014; and September 19-21, 2014.
- The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $4,000.00 per count on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his release from jail.  If the defendant fails to comply with Dane County Bail Monitoring. Cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $10,000.00, as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. If Defendant posts this higher amount of bail and is released from jail, the Sheriff is directed to notify DCBM. If Defendant is out of custody, supervision by DCBM is required to enforce conditions of release and protect the public.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Anne U - The Court finds sustantial evidence that knowing and malicious prevention or dissuasion of the above victim(s) is reasonably likely to occur.  The above conditions of release are hereby ordered pursuant to Sec. 940.47 and Chapter 969.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with David U and/or Daria U.
- Defendant shall not be within any visual or physical proximity of Anne U.
- Defendant shall not be at or on Waldorf Blvd in Madison, Wisconsin.
- Defendant shall not be at MATC-Truax Field in Madison, Wisconsin.
- Defendant shall not be at The University Hospital and/or University Clinic located on Highland Avenue in Madison, Wisconsin.
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon and they shall be turned over to Detective Denise Armstrong immediately upon your release from      Dane County Jail.
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
- Defendant shall not be at The Princeton Club located on Watts Road in Madison, Wisconsin until anytime after 4:30 pm.
- Defendant shall not be at the 300 block of Patrick Drive in Waunakee, Wisconsin.
REVISED - 2ND MODIFICATION:  Added fine/costs in 14CF131 to existing plan.  Defn to pay $30/MO continuing 9-5-14 (14CF131 and 11TR14552).  DPA retained in 11TR14552.

Defendant in court with Attorney Robert Thomas Ruth.  Robert J. Kaiser appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defn filed mtn to dismiss cts. 2 & 3. Discussion by CT and counsel. Trial judge will address mtn to dismiss if boundover. ADA Kaiser requests CT find the cts are transactionally related. No obj by defn. CT found they are related. Det. Denise Armstrong sworn & testified. Direct exam by ADA Kaiser. Witness identified the defn. Ex's 1-2 marked & offered. Obj to exhibit 2. Agreement to receipt of Ex 1 and not Ex 2. No cross exam. Witness excused. State moves for bindover. Defn objects. CT found pc and ordered bindover. Defn had filed mtn to modify bond. Argument by Atty Ruth. No obj by the State. CT granted mtn to amend bail to remove the prohibition of alcohol. All other bail conditions to remain the same.
